intro: Convolvulus pallidus, commonly known as the pale convolvulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters, often with five petals. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas.
